basics.name: Lyle Goodyear
basics.label: Undergraduate
basics.summary: Interested in market design and social and economic networks.

work.name: Stanford MS&E Department
work.summary: Using LLMs to simulate realistic human economic behavior in multi-agent games. Built LLM-powered agent-based model of network congestion, represented LLM agent decision process as a graph. Improving doctor-patient messaging using LLMs, part of Stanford Medicineâ€™s 4T study. Created pipeline to generate messages, evaluate reading level and sentiment.
highlights: Advised by professor Ramesh Johari and mentored by Ph.D. candidate Rachel Guo.

work.name: Computer Science Research, Stanford
work.summary: Built benchmark to assess LLMs in model building and experiment design; implemented probabilistic models in Python, built LLM-powered applications.

volunteer.summary: Led a robotics team to international competitions. Advanced to FIRST International Championship in Houston twice, ranked 27 out of 7000 worldwide. Implemented PID control systems in Java.

Co-founded 501(c)3 educational non-profit supporting 17 robotics teams, 50+ volunteers, and 200+ students. Fundraised and secured grants totaling over $35,000, organized two robotics competitions at Schreiner University.

Presented to the offices of US Representative Chip Roy and Senator Ted Cruz. Advocated increased funding for Student Support and Academic Enrichment Grants (Title IV-A) of the 2022 appropriations bill; Title IV-A funding increased $85 million over the 2021 fiscal year following SASA conference.

certificates.name: Retrieving, Processing, and Visualizing Data with Python
